result.execSummary:
The defendant John Peter Repinski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
No huber requested.

Submit to DNA sample before released from sentence.

Court orders the court costs waived.  Court orders $375.00 on file for attorney fees to be applied and balance of atty fees in amount of $86.69 to be paid in 90 days.  Failure to pay will result in one day jail for each $25 outstanding.
